main event: On June 21, 1954 in Clayton, Alabama, a civilian witnessed a brilliant shooting star, which appeared as a cigar-shaped light moving from southeast to northwest at a 45-degree elevation. The object was observed for 39 seconds and was considered to be a very brilliant meteorite, possibly associated with a case in Savannah, Ga on the same date.
interesting points: The object appeared as a brilliant shooting star and maintained its brilliance throughout the observation.
It was described as a cigar-shaped light at a 45-degree elevation moving from southeast to northwest.
The witness observed the object make left and right turns during the sighting.
The witness, a hardware merchant and outgoing president of the Rotary Club, appeared stable and hesitant to report the incident due to fear of consequences.
The report was received by the OSI at 10:23 hours on June 22 and turned in to intelligence at 15:30 on the same day.
sighted object: Cigar-shaped light moving from southeast to northwest
